turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about The Butterfly Revolution.
turn.1: What was the leading theme of William Butler's novel The Butterfly Revolution?
turn.2: The Butterfly Revolution The Butterfly Revolution is a novel by author William Butler, first published in 1961.
turn.3: What was the setting of the novel?
turn.4: Set in an American spring camp for boys, Camp High Pines, the novel is written as the diary of thirteen-year-old protagonist Winston Weyn.
turn.6: Winston, an educated and somewhat bullish boy, is sent to Camp High Pines as a gift for his birthday.
turn.7: Why is he sent to camp?
turn.8: Winston's father, who is concerned by his son's lack of interest in "normal" activities such as sports and playing outside, feels attending camp will be a healthy activity for his son.
turn.9: What are the other characters in the novel?
turn.10: The campers at High Pines are categorized in three groups: the colours (roughly 9–11 years old), the comics (roughly 12–14 years old), and the zodiacs (somewhere between 15 and 17 years old).
turn.11: What is the significance of the three groups?
turn.12: Winston, who falls into the middle category, attends camp along with his older brother, Howard, who falls in the latter.
